intro: Hieracium regale, commonly known as the royal hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble small daisies. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring hairy stems and broad, lance-shaped leaves. Its showy yellow flowers bloom in late spring to early summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Hieracium regale is often found in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, and it is considered a weed in some agricultural areas.
